http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title.value: Georgia Performance Standards for Health Education

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: The new Georgia Performance Standards for Health Education are content standards and provide an outline for curriculum development. They are not a curriculum, nor do they constitute objectives for a curriculum. However, they reflect the most recent concept in health curricula, which is to provide a framework from which curricula can be developed that are appropriate for state and local needs. The new Georgia Performance Standards for Health Education are based on the eight National Health Education Standards, copyright 2007, developed by the Joint Committee on National Health Education Standards which consisted of representatives from the following organizations and agencies: American Association for Health Education, American School Health Association, American Public Health Association, and the Society of State Directors of Health, Physical Education, and Recreation and sponsored by the American Cancer Society.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Design a personal plan to improve health by quitting or helping others to stop the use of tobacco.
Design a plan for increasing or maintaining physical activity that demonstrates strengths and improves weaknesses while minimizing risky behaviors.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Monitor personal progress in achieving short-term and long-term personal health goals.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Monitor progress toward achieving a healthier diet goal.
Keep a journal of stressful events, how you coped with the stressors, and the outcome of each coping strategy.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce health risks.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce health risks. High school students will model health-enhancing behaviors to prevent injuries, diseases, and disorders. Students will practice strategies for reducing harmful and risk taking behaviors now and in the future.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Demonstrate individual responsibility for improving personal health.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Participate in a variety of personal health assessments to determine strategies for health enhancement and risk reduction.
Develop a plan for healthy weight management for teenagers.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Choose a variety of healthy practices and behaviors that will maintain or improve health.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Use and evaluate safety techniques to avoid and reduce injury (e.g., earthquakes, fire, flood).
Identify a variety of behaviors that avoid or reduce risks to self and others.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Model behaviors to avoid or reduce health risks.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Debate ways to reduce the negative impact on the environment.
Mimic impulsive behaviors and explain strategies for controlling them.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: The students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health by creating health enhancing messages and encourage others to adopt healthy behaviors. High school students will act as a health resource by communicating valid information about health issues. Students will demonstrate advocacy skills to encourage others to acquire health-enhancing behaviors.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Demonstrate accurate peer and societal norms to create a health-enhancing message.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create a poster advocating acceptance for a diversity of body types.
Create a public service announcement promoting the importance of not drinking while driving.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Model how to influence and support others to make positive health choices.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Develop a presentation on how to help others prevent and manage conflict and stress in healthy ways.
Interview someone in the health profession about the risks of oral cancer and how to prevent it and develop an information packet.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Coordinate with others to advocate for improving personal, family, and community health.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Engage others to develop health campaigns which promote care, consideration, and concern for others. (e.g., HIV, cancer, diabetes).
Advocate for healthy eating choices at school, home, and in the community through a letter writing campaign. (e.g., TV commercial, campaign, billboard).

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Create health messages and communication techniques to target specific audiences.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create a skit to demonstrate ways of handling abuse (e.g., sexual harassment, bullying, hazing, fighting, and hate crimes).
Write a letter to your classmates encouraging them to avoid distractions while driving.
